hanzi-su-wiki:
貪

Значения

Жаждать, домогаться

Мнемоника

Алчность, жажда денег 貝 сейчас 今, каждый день и всегда.

Варианты

贪
purpleculture_pinyin:
tān
to have a voracious desire for; to covet; greedy; corrupt
иметь ненасытное желание; желать; жадный; испорченный
rtega_mnemonic:
貪貪RS
贪贪		greedy, covet, hope for, search for
  • RS. in the presence 今 of money 貝: covet
  • want money 貝 now 今
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 贪)
Pictophonetic: 今 indicates the sound; 貝 (money) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
貪污 [ tān wū ]: to be corrupt; corruption; to embezzle
貪婪 [ tān lán ]: avaricious; greedy; rapacious; insatiable; avid
貪圖 [ tān tú ]: to covet; to seek (riches, fame)
貪官 [ tān guān ]: corrupt official; grasping functionary; greedy mandarin
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 今 [ jīn ] modern, current; today, now
    • 貝 [ bèi ] sea shell; money, currency
heisig_chinese_memo: Gimme all your money now!" said the greedy criminal.
koohiiStory1: Whatever you covet at the moment (now), can be bought with money. Well, _almost_ anything....
koohiiStory2: One begins one's life coveting money. One ends one's life coveting time -- those precious seconds ticking away on the clock. Remember to always put time over money (in this kanji and in life).
Ru_Radicals: 个 (китайский счётный суффикс), ハ, 目 (глаз), 貝 (раковина)
Ru_trainchinese:
tān: (глаг) жаждать, гнаться за; расхищать, предаваться коррупции
tān: (глаг) быть ненасытным, быть жадным (до чего-л.)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: now (今) the shellfish (貝) covets ...
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Greedy people watch the time pass on the clock and regret only thinking about shells all their lives afterwards.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle from " Bei " to "亼" form. The seal script starts from " Bei " from "今", and "今" is a symbol of meaning and a sound. " Bei " is currency and property, "亼" is like a tongue with its mouth facing downwards (Shen Gu Yankui), with its mouth open facing the " shell " representing wealth, just like a person coveting money or wanting to swallow property, " greedy " The meaning of shape and desire is quite obvious. "Said Wen": "Greed, desire for things. Congbei, today's sound." Duan Yucai's note: "Greed, desire for things, too. Both the heart and the female are greedy, all training greed. Congbei, today's sound."

Han silk books are used as the original meaning, such as "Mawangdui. Line 135 of the Book of Political Strategists in the Warring States Period: "Qin, the country of greed and hostility"; another example is "Mawangdui. "Warring States Political Strategist Book" line 148: "Corruption and profit."

The " greedy " on bamboo slips of the Warring States period is commonly used as " han ". Such as "Guodian Jane. "Yu Cong 3" Jian 19: "Land can be greedy (including) those who live", " greedy " is pronounced " Han ", meaning that the land conserves all things; ancient books are also commonly used as " exploration ", such as "Han Shu. "Guo Gong Chuan Lun": "If it is to push oneself to discuss things, but to give up status to greedy," Li Xian's note: "Greed and exploration are at the same time", the whole sentence means that if you can put yourself to consider things, give up appearances to explore the essence of things.
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle from " Bei " to "亼", like opening the mouth to the shell, expressing greed for money. Xiao Zhuan starts from " Bei " and " Today " also sounds. The original meaning is love of money, that is, unscrupulously obtaining property illegally.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「貝」從「亼」形。篆文從「貝」從「今」，「今」為義符亦標聲。「貝」為貨幣、財物，「亼」象口朝下伸舌之形（參谷衍奎），張口朝向代表財寶之「貝」，猶如人向錢財垂涎或欲吞食財物之狀，「貪」字構形會欲物之意頗為明顯。《說文》：「貪，欲物也。从貝，今聲。」段玉裁注：「貪，欲物也。心部惏、女部婪，皆訓貪。从貝，今聲。」

　　漢帛書用作本義，如《馬王堆．戰國縱橫家書》第135行：「秦，貪戾之國也」；又如《馬王堆．戰國縱橫家書》第148行：「貪戾好利」。

　　戰國竹簡「貪」通作「含」。如《郭店簡．語叢三》簡19：「地能貪（含）之生之者」，「貪」讀作「含」，意謂土地涵養萬物；古書亦通作「探」，如《後漢書．郭躬傳論》：「若乃推己以議物，捨狀以貪情」，李賢注：「貪與探同也」，全句意謂如能設身處地考慮事物，放棄表狀探究事物的本質。
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從「貝」從「亼」，象張口向着貝，表示貪財。小篆从「貝」，「今」亦聲。本義為愛財，即不擇手段地非法取得財物。

甲骨文從「 貝 」從「 亼 」形。篆文從「 貝 」從「 今 」，「 今 」為義符亦標聲。「 貝 」為貨幣、財物，「 亼 」象口朝下伸舌之形（參谷衍奎），張口朝向代表財寶之「 貝 」，猶如人向錢財垂涎或欲吞食財物之狀，「 貪 」字構形會欲物之意頗為明顯。《說文》：「貪，欲物也。从貝，今聲。」段玉裁注：「貪，欲物也。心部惏、女部婪，皆訓貪。从貝，今聲。」 漢帛書用作本義，如《馬王堆．戰國縱橫家書》第135行：「秦，貪戾之國也」；又如《馬王堆．戰國縱橫家書》第148行：「貪戾好利」。 戰國竹簡「 貪 」通作「 含 」。如《郭店簡．語叢三》簡19：「地能貪（含）之生之者」，「 貪 」讀作「 含 」，意謂土地涵養萬物；古書亦通作「 探 」，如《後漢書．郭躬傳論》：「若乃推己以議物，捨狀以貪情」，李賢注：「貪與探同也」，全句意謂如能設身處地考慮事物，放棄表狀探究事物的本質。
Oracle from " Bei" to " 亼" form. The seal script starts from " Bei" from " 今", and " 今" is a symbol of meaning and a sound. " Bei" is currency and property, " 亼" is like a tongue with its mouth facing downwards (Shen Gu Yankui), with its mouth open facing the " shell" representing wealth, just like a person coveting money or wanting to swallow property, " greedy" The meaning of shape and desire is quite obvious. "Said Wen": "Greed, desire for things. Congbei, today's sound." Duan Yucai's note: "Greed, desire for things, too. Both the heart and the female are greedy, all training greed. Congbei, today's sound." Han silk books are used as the original meaning, such as "Mawangdui. Line 135 of the Book of Political Strategists in the Warring States Period: "Qin, the country of greed and hostility"; another example is "Mawangdui. "Warring States Political Strategist Book" line 148: "Corruption and profit." The " greedy" on bamboo slips of the Warring States period is commonly used as " han". Such as "Guodian Jane. "Yu Cong 3" Jian 19: "Land can be greedy (including) those who live", " greedy" is pronounced " Han", meaning that the land conserves all things; ancient books are also commonly used as " exploration", such as "Han Shu. "Guo Gong Chuan Lun": "If it is to push oneself to discuss things, but to give up status to greedy," Li Xian's note: "Greed and exploration are at the same time", the whole sentence means that if you can put yourself to consider things, give up appearances to explore the essence of things.

貪字的基本解释

貪
tān
见“贪”。

貪字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tān］
［《廣韻》他含切，平覃，透。］
“贪1”的繁体字。
(1)爱财。
(2)纳赃受贿；贪污。
(3)求无满足。
(4)贪图；片面追求。
(5)欲；希望。
(6)通“探”。取；探求。

貪字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【貝字部】　貪； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页1205第16
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?他含切，音?。【說文】欲物也。【釋名】貪，探也。探入他分也。【詩·大雅】貪人敗類。【禮·禮運】用人之仁，去其貪。【屈原·離騷】衆皆競進以貪婪兮。【王逸註】愛財曰貪，愛食曰婪。　又【集韻】他紺切，音探。義同。

小篆楷体

[①]［tān］
["Guangyun" he has cut, flat tan, and through. ]
The traditional characters of "貪1".
(1) Love money.
(2) Accepting stolen goods and accepting bribes; corruption.
(3) Seek unsatisfaction.
(4) Covetous; one-sided pursuit.
(5) Desire; hope.
(6) Through "exploration". Take; explore.

[Poetry·Daya] Greedy people and scum. 【Rite·Rite Luck】Employ people's benevolence, and get rid of their greed. [Qu Yuan·Lisao] Everyone is greedy. [Wang Yi's Note] Love of money means greed, and love of food means greed.　[Jiyun] He cut and cut, sound detective. The same meaning.
